action.action-desc: Mr. Rangel (for himself and Mr. Moran) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend the Military Selective Service Act to require the registration of women with the Selective Service System in light of the Department of Defense elimination of the rule excluding women from direct ground combat assignments in the Armed Forces.

section.header: Nondiscrimination in application of Military Selective Service registration requirement for citizens and certain residents of the United States

subsection.header: Applicability to all citizens and residents within specified age range
subsection.text: Section 3(a) of the Military Selective Service Act (50 U.S.C. App. 453(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking male both places it appears; and
by inserting or herself after himself; and

paragraph.text: in the second sentence, by striking he continues and inserting the alien continues.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
